summary: "Manhunter" is a 1986 American thriller film directed by Michael Mann. It's about an FBI profiler, Will Graham (William Petersen), who comes out of retirement to help catch a serial killer called the Tooth Fairy. Graham must face his past and talk to a dangerous criminal, Hannibal Lecter (Brian Cox), who almost killed him. The film shows how the FBI uses forensics to catch killers and how these cases affect the profilers. It was the first movie based on Thomas Harris' books about Hannibal Lecter. Although it didn't do well at first, it's now considered a cult film and is liked for its acting and unique look.
title: Manhunter (film)
